Draco's Way Book 1: The Awakening
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Short Fiction: Draco's Way Book 1: The Awakening
By Draco the Sage on Saturday, January 5, 2002 - 07:21 pm:

Light! I see light! For the first time in some years. Where am I? Who..no. I am Draco! Draco the Sage! True Dragyn! Able to instill fear in the hearts of the enemies I have. Ahh...but they must all be dead.
"Well? what is it?"
"I dunno! It looks like a Dragon-Monster."
"C'mon Aroma! You know that's impossible!"
What? Those noises...speech? Humans...where? Seabirds? ...Monsters...I remember monsters...
~1000 years before~
"Move, Perfection!"
"I am, Master."
"Noooooo!"
"Haha! I have beaten thou, Dortan."
"Again? Draco, thou art too good."
" I know...I know..."
"What was that?"
"Save the mosters! Seal them into the tablets!"
"Save...them..."
Draco fell to the ground. Earth piled around him. There he slept for 1,000 years.
~Present~
"What? Humans! Where am I? The monsters! Are they safe? Dortan, where's Dortan?"
Aroma and Zest looked surprised. "Monsters? They're only in tablets. Who's Dortan? And, you are on Age Island, Mr... Mr...?"
"Draco. Draco the Sage."
Draco turned human. This he had learned to do as a hatchling.
"You may call me Ace."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Don't worry, there'll be more later-Draco
